Description: The telephone for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the telephone may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Contact Fax
Description: The fax for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the fax may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Internet Address
Description: The website of the organisation.

Name: Organisation eDelivery Gateway
Description: The organisation's uniform resource locator for exchange of data and documents.

Name: Organisation Natural Person
Description: The organisation is a natural person.

Name: Organisation Role
Description: The role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. buyer, winner). A notice must contain all organisations in the procedure that have the role of a buyer; a winner; a review body; a buyer acquiring supplies and/or services intended for other buyers; a buyer awarding public contracts or concluding framework agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other buyers.

Name: Organisation Subrole
Description: The sub-role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. group leader, organisation providing additional information about the procurement procedure).

Name: Buyer Profile URL
Description: The website where the buyer publishes information regarding procurement procedures (e.g. notices, procurement documents).

Name: Buyer Legal Type
Description: The type of buyer according to procurement legislation (e.g. central government authority, body governed by public law, public undertaking).

Name: Activity Authority
Description: The main activity of the contracting authority.

Name: Activity Entity
Description: The main activity of the contracting entity.

Name: Winner Size
Description: The size of the winner, tenderer or subcontractor (e.g. micro enterprise, small enterprise, medium enterprise).

Name: Winner Owner Nationality
Description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor; as published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation. If such a register does not exist (e.g. in case of non-EU contractors) then equivalent information from other sources.

Name: Winner Listed
Description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor is not published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation, because the winner is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.

Name: Purpose Lot Identifier
Description: The identifier of a lot. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of a part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure. The information in the purpose section refers to this lot or part.

Name: Internal Identifier
Description: The internal identifier used for files regarding the procurement procedure or lot before a procedure identifier is given (e.g. coming from the buyer's document management system or procurement planning system).

Name: Main Nature
Description: The main nature (e.g. works) of what is being bought. In case of mixed procurement (e.g. a procedure for both works and services), the main nature may be, for example, the one with the highest estimated value. This information must be given for the whole procedure.

Name: Additional Nature
Description: The nature (e.g. services) of what is being bought, additional to Main Nature.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Estimated Value
Description: The estimated maximum value of the procurement procedure or lot. Estimated refers to estimation at the time of launching the call for competition. Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system, over their whole duration, including options and renewals.
Element: Initial estimated total value of the contract/lot

Name: Group Framework Estimated Maximum Value Lot Identifier
Description: Identifiers of lots. These lots form a group whose estimated maximum value is lower than the sum of individual estimated maximum values of all the lots together (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots).

Name: Group Framework Estimated Maximum Value
Description: The estimated maximum value which can be spent in a framework agreement within a group of lots. This information can be provided when the estimated maximum value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of estimated values of individual lots in this group (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). Estimated refers to estimation at the time of launching the call for competition. Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Classification Type
Description: The type of classification describing the purchase (e.g. the common procurement vocabulary).

Name: Main Classification Code
Description: The code from the classification that best characterizes the purchase.

Name: Additional Classification Codes
Description: An additional code from the classification that also characterize the purchase.

Name: Quantity
Description: The number of units required.

Name: Unit
Description: The unit which the good, service, or work comes in, for example hours or kilograms. Where CPV code is a supply which does not need a further unit (e.g. cars), then no unit needs to be given and quantity is taken to be a count, e.g. the "number of cars".

Name: Options
Description: The buyer reserves the right (not an obligation) for additional purchases from the contractor (while the contract is valid).

Name: Options Description
Description: The description of the options.

Name: Place Performance Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the place of performance section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Place Performance Street
Description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the place of performance and further identification (e.g. building number).
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance City
Description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Post Code
Description: The postcode of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Country Subdivision
Description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS). The NUTS3 classification code must be used.

Name: Place Performance Country Code
Description: The country of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Services Other
Description: There are other restrictions on the place of performance (e.g. "anywhere in the European Economic Area", "anywhere in the given country").

Name: Place Performance Additional Information
Description: Additional information about the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Duration Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the duration section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts)

Name: Duration Start Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will start.

Name: Duration Period
Description: The (estimated) period from the start to the end of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This must include any options and renewals.

Name: Duration End Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will finish.

Name: Duration Other
Description: The duration is unknown, unlimited, etc.

Name: Renewal Maximum
Description: The maximum number of times the contract can be renewed. By renewing, the buyer reserves the right (i.e. not an obligation) to renew the contract (i.e. extend its duration) without a new procurement procedure. For example, a contract may be valid for one year and the buyer may keep a possibility to renew it (e.g. once, twice) for another three months, if he is content with the services he received.

Name: Renewal Description
Description: Any other information about the renewal(s).

Name: Funds Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. The information in the EU funds section refers to this lot or these lots.

Name: EU Funds
Description: The procurement is at least partially financed by European Union funds such as the European Structural and Investment Funds or grants awarded by the European Union.
Element: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds

Name: Cross Border Law
Description: The applicable law when buyers from different countries procure together within one procurement procedure.
Element: In the case of joint procurement involving different countries, state applicable national procurement law:

Name: Procedure Type
Description: The type of procurement procedure (e.g. according to the types given in the procurement Directives).

Name: Procedure Features
Description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information must be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.
Element: Identification of the national rules applicable to the procedure

Name: Procedure Features
Description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information must be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.
Element: Main features of the award procedure

Name: Direct Award Justification Code
Description: A justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Name: Direct Award Justification Previous Procedure Identifier
Description: An identifier of a previous procedure that justifies the use of a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. justifying a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Name: Direct Award Justification Text
Description: The justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
Element: Please explain in a clear and comprehensive manner why the award of the contract without prior publication in the Official Journal of the European Union is lawful, by stating the relevant facts and, as appropriate, the conclusions of law in accordance with the directive

Name: Award Criteria Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots or one or more groups of lots. The information in the award criteria section refers to this lot, these lots, this group, or these groups.

Name: Award Criterion Type
Description: Whether the criterion concerns the price, the cost, or a non-price non-cost attribute of the tender. (Price is the acquisition price; cost is any other non-price monetary criterion.)

Name: Award Criterion Name
Description: The name of the award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Description
Description: The description of the award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Number
Description: A number linked to an award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Number Weight
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).

Name: Award Criterion Number Fixed
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a fixed value (e.g. a fixed price, a fixed cost).

Name: Award Criterion Number Threshold
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).

Name: Award Criteria Complicated
Description: The mathematical equation or any other description used for complicated weighing of criteria (e.g. non-linear weighing, the analytic hierarchy process) when a weighing cannot be expressed per criterion.

Name: Award Criteria Order Justification
Description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighing.

Name: Techniques Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the techniques section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Framework Agreement
Description: Whether a framework agreement with, without, or with and without the reopening of competition is involved.
Element: The procurement involves the establishment of a framework agreement

Name: Framework Buyer Categories
Description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. "all hospitals in the Tuscany region").

Name: Dynamic Purchasing System
Description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved and, in case of central purchasing bodies, whether it can be used by buyers not listed in this notice.

Name: Dynamic Purchasing System Termination
Description: The dynamic purchasing system is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded in the dynamic purchasing system. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.

Name: Electronic Auction
Description: An electronic auction is used.

Name: Communication Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the communication section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Review Deadline Description
Description: The description of the time limits for review procedures.

Name: Notice Value
Description: The value of all contracts awarded in this notice, including options and renewals.

Name: Notice Framework Value
Description: The maximum or estimated value which can be spent within the framework agreement(s) announced in this notice over its whole duration, in all lots, including options and renewals.

Name: Group Framework Value Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of several lots within this procedure. These lots form a group whose maximum or estimated value is lower than the sum of individual maximum or estimated values of all the lots together (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots).

Name: Group Framework Value
Description: The maximum or estimated value which can be spent in a framework agreement within a group of lots. This information can be provided when the maximum or estimated value of a group of lots is lower than the sum of values of individual lots (e.g. when the same budget is shared for several lots). The value covers all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Result Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of a lot. The information in the procedure lot result section refers to this lot.

Name: Winner Chosen
Description: Whether a winner was chosen.

Name: Not Awarded Reason
Description: The reason for not choosing a winner.
Element: No tenders or requests to participate were received or all were rejected

Name: Not Awarded Reason
Description: The reason for not choosing a winner.

Name: Framework Maximum Value
Description: The maximum value which can be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Framework Estimated Value
Description: The estimated value which will be spent within a framework agreement over its whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Received Submissions Count
Description: Number of tenders or requests to participate received. Tenders including variants or multiple tenders submitted (for one lot) by the same tenderer should be counted as one tender.

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from SMEs

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from tenderers from other EU Member States

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from tenderers from non-EU Member States

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received by electronic means

Name: Tender Identifier
Description: An identifier of a tender. The information in the tender section refers to this tender.

Name: Tender Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of a lot or a group of lots for which the tender was submitted. The information in the tender section refers to this lot.

Name: Tender Value
Description: The value of the tender or another result; including options and renewals. In case of the modification notice, the value of the modification.

Name: Tender Rank
Description: The position of the tender (i.e. whether the tender ended up first, second, third, etc.) in a design contest, some framework agreements with multiple winners (e.g. cascades) or an innovation partnership.

Name: Tender Variant
Description: The tender is a variant.

Name: Subcontracting
Description: Whether at least a part of the contract will be subcontracted.
Element: ⃞The contract is likely to be subcontracted

Name: Subcontracting Value Known
Description: The buyer knows at least the estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
Element: Value or proportion likely to be subcontracted to third parties

Name: Subcontracting Value
Description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.

Name: Subcontracting Percentage Known
Description: The buyer knows at least the estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.
Element: Value or proportion likely to be subcontracted to third parties

Name: Subcontracting Percentage
Description: The estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.

Name: Subcontracting Description
Description: The description of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.
Element: Short description of the part of the contract to be subcontracted

Name: Contract Identifier
Description: An identifier of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision. The information in the contract section refers to this contract or decision.

Name: Contract Tender Identifier
Description: An identifier of the tender or another result that led to this contract.

Name: Contract Title
Description: The name of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision.

Name: Winner Decision Date
Description: The date of the official decision choosing the winning tender.

Name: Contract Conclusion Date
Description: The date when the contract was concluded. Typically, this is the date when the last contractual party signed the contract. However, if no contract is signed, then the date of contract conclusion may correspond to other dates (e.g. the date when the buyer notified the winning tenderer). The date of contract conclusion is always later than the end of the standstill period and only once any evidence submitted by the winner has been verified.
Element: Date of conclusion of the contract

Name: Contract Framework Agreement
Description: The contract is awarded within a framework agreement.

Name: Contract URL
Description: The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) of the contract.

Name: Contract EU Funds Name
Description: The name of the European Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. about concrete projects, not just operational programs.)

Name: Contract EU Funds Identifier
Description: An identifier of the European Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. about concrete projects, not just operational programs.)

Name: Strategic Procurement Notice Section Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the strategic procurement section refers to this section or these sections.

Name: Strategic Procurement
Description: Use of a technical specification, selection criterion, award criterion, or contract performance condition aims to reduce the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfil social objectives and/or buy an innovative work, supply or service.

Name: Strategic Procurement Description
Description: Description of the use of a technical specification, selection criterion, award criterion, or contract performance condition aims to reduce the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfil social objectives and/or buy an innovative work, supply or service.

Name: Green Procurement
Description: An approach to reducing the environmental impacts of the work, supply or service (e.g. requesting compliance with an environmental label).

Name: Social Procurement
Description: A social objective promoted by the works, supplies or services (e.g. fair working conditions).

Name: Innovative Procurement
Description: An indication that innovative works, supplies or services are being bought (e.g. the procured works, supplies or services being novel for the whole market).

Name: Accessibility
Description: The use of accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities in the technical specifications.

Name: Accessibility Justification
Description: The justification for not including accessibility criteria even though the procurement is intended for use by natural persons.

Name: Buyer Review Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the additional information section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Buyer Review Complainants
Description: The number of organisations that requested the buyer to review any of its decisions (e.g. the technical specifications, award decision).

Name: Buyer Review Requests Count
Description: The number of requests the buyer received to review any of its decisions.

Name: Buyer Review Requests Irregularity Type
Description: The type of irregularity alleged in the review requests.

Name: Additional Information Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the additional information section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Procurement Relaunch
Description: This cancelled or unsuccessful procedure or lot will be relaunched.

Name: PIN Competition Termination
Description: The prior information notice used as a call for competition (or a specific lot) is terminated. No further contracts, besides those published in this notice, will be awarded following this prior information notice used as a call for competition. This field can be used even if no contracts are awarded in the contract award notice.
Element: The contracting authority will not award any further contracts based on the above prior information notice

Name: Additional Information
Description: Any information not mentioned elsewhere.

Name: Unpublished Identifier
Description: Identifier of the field that shall not be immediately published. Only fields concerning the Result value and groups of fields concerning the Tender and Procedure Lot Result can be unpublished. In the case of the sectoral Directive, the award criteria, the procurement procedure, certain dates and in certain cases information about the nature and quantity of a service can be unpublished as well.

Name: Unpublished Justification Code
Description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field.

Name: Unpublished Justification Description
Description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field and for the choice of a later date at which it can be published.

Name: Unpublished Accessibility Date
Description: The later date at which the originally unpublished field shall be published.

Name: Procedure Identifier
Description: The European Public Procurement Procedure Identifier, a unique identifier of a procurement procedure. Including this identifier in all published versions of this notice (e.g. published on TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement procedures around the EU.

Name: Notice Identifier
Description: The European Public Procurement Notice Identifier of this notice. Including this identifier in all published version of this notice (e.g. TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement notices around the EU.

Name: Notice Version
Description: The version of the notice. This helps, for example, to avoid errors caused by multiple change notices sent at a similar time.

Name: Procedure Legal Basis
Description: The legal basis (e.g. a European Directive or Regulation, national law) under which the procurement procedure takes place.

Name: Form Type
Description: The type of form according to procurement legislation.

Name: Notice Type
Description: The type of notice according to procurement legislation.

Name: Notice Dispatch Date
Description: The date and time when the notice has been sent to TED.
Element: Date of dispatch of this notice: (dd/mm/yyyy)

Name: Notice Publication Date Preferred
Description: The preferred date of publication of the notice on TED (e.g. to avoid publication during a national holiday).

Name: Notice Official Language
Description: The language(s) in which this notice is officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.

Name: Previous Planning Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of a prior information notice used only for information, the identifier of a part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure. The information in the previous planning section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Previous Planning Identifier
Description: The identifier of a prior information notice or another similar notice related to this notice.

Name: Previous Planning Part Identifier
Description: The identifier of a part of a prior information notice or another similar notice related to this notice.

Name: Organisation Notice Section Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the organisation section refers to this section or these sections.

Name: Organisation Name
Description: The official name of the organisation.

Name: Organisation Identifier
Description: An identifier of the organisation. All of the organisation's identifiers shall be given.

Name: Organisation Part Name
Description: The name of a part of an organisation (e.g. the relevant department of a large buyer).

Name: Organisation Street
Description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the organisation's physical address and further identification (e.g. building number).

Name: Organisation City
Description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Post Code
Description: The post code of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Country Subdivision
Description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) of the organisation's physical address. The NUTS3 classification code must be used.

Name: Organisation Country Code
Description: The country of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Contact Point
Description: The name of the department or other contact point for communicating with the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the contact point may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).

Name: Organisation Contact Email Address
Description: The email for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the email may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Contact Telephone Number
Description: The telephone for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the telephone may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Contact Fax
Description: The fax for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the fax may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Internet Address
Description: The website of the organisation.

Name: Organisation eDelivery Gateway
Description: The organisation's uniform resource locator for exchange of data and documents.

Name: Organisation Natural Person
Description: The organisation is a natural person.

Name: Organisation Role
Description: The role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. buyer, winner). A notice must contain all organisations in the procedure that have the role of a buyer; a winner; a review body; a buyer acquiring supplies and/or services intended for other buyers; a buyer awarding public contracts or concluding framework agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other buyers.

Name: Organisation Subrole
Description: The sub-role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. group leader, organisation providing additional information about the procurement procedure).

Name: Buyer Profile URL
Description: The website where the buyer publishes information regarding procurement procedures (e.g. notices, procurement documents).

Name: Buyer Legal Type
Description: The type of buyer according to procurement legislation (e.g. central government authority, body governed by public law, public undertaking).

Name: Buyer Contracting Entity
Description: The buyer is a contracting entity.

Name: Activity Authority
Description: The main activity of the contracting authority.

Name: Activity Entity
Description: The main activity of the contracting entity.

Name: Winner Size
Description: The size of the winner, tenderer or subcontractor (e.g. micro enterprise, small enterprise, medium enterprise).

Name: Winner Owner Nationality
Description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor; as published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation. If such a register does not exist (e.g. in case of non-EU contractors) then equivalent information from other sources.

Name: Winner Listed
Description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the beneficiary owner(s) of the winner, tenderer, or subcontractor is not published in the register(s) established by anti-money laundering legislation, because the winner is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.

Name: Purpose Lot Identifier
Description: The identifier of a lot. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of a part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure. The information in the purpose section refers to this lot or part.

Name: Internal Identifier
Description: The internal identifier used for files regarding the procurement procedure or lot before a procedure identifier is given (e.g. coming from the buyer's document management system or procurement planning system).

Name: Main Nature
Description: The main nature (e.g. works) of what is being bought. In case of mixed procurement (e.g. a procedure for both works and services), the main nature may be, for example, the one with the highest estimated value. This information must be given for the whole procedure.

Name: Additional Nature
Description: The nature (e.g. services) of what is being bought, additional to Main Nature.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Estimated Value
Description: The estimated maximum value of the procurement procedure or lot. Estimated refers to estimation at the time of launching the call for competition. Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system, over their whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Classification Type
Description: The type of classification describing the purchase (e.g. the common procurement vocabulary).

Name: Main Classification Code
Description: The code from the classification that best characterizes the purchase.

Name: Additional Classification Codes
Description: An additional code from the classification that also characterize the purchase.

Name: Quantity
Description: The number of units required.

Name: Unit
Description: The unit which the good, service, or work comes in, for example hours or kilograms. Where CPV code is a supply which does not need a further unit (e.g. cars), then no unit needs to be given and quantity is taken to be a count, e.g. the "number of cars".

Name: Options
Description: The buyer reserves the right (not an obligation) for additional purchases from the contractor (while the contract is valid).

Name: Options Description
Description: The description of the options.

Name: Place Performance Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the place of performance section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Place Performance Street
Description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the place of performance and further identification (e.g. building number).
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance City
Description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Post Code
Description: The postcode of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Country Subdivision
Description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS). The NUTS3 classification code must be used.

Name: Place Performance Country Code
Description: The country of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Services Other
Description: There are other restrictions on the place of performance (e.g. "anywhere in the European Economic Area", "anywhere in the given country").

Name: Place Performance Additional Information
Description: Additional information about the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Duration Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the duration section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts)

Name: Duration Start Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will start.

Name: Duration Period
Description: The (estimated) period from the start to the end of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This must include any options and renewals.

Name: Duration End Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will finish.

Name: Duration Other
Description: The duration is unknown, unlimited, etc.

Name: Renewal Maximum
Description: The maximum number of times the contract can be renewed. By renewing, the buyer reserves the right (i.e. not an obligation) to renew the contract (i.e. extend its duration) without a new procurement procedure. For example, a contract may be valid for one year and the buyer may keep a possibility to renew it (e.g. once, twice) for another three months, if he is content with the services he received.

Name: Renewal Description
Description: Any other information about the renewal(s).

Name: Funds Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. The information in the EU funds section refers to this lot or these lots.

Name: EU Funds
Description: The procurement is at least partially financed by European Union funds such as the European Structural and Investment Funds or grants awarded by the European Union.
Element: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds

Name: Cross Border Law
Description: The applicable law when buyers from different countries procure together within one procurement procedure.

Name: Procedure Features
Description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information must be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.
Element: Main features of the award procedure

Name: Direct Award Justification Code
Description: A justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Name: Direct Award Justification Previous Procedure Identifier
Description: An identifier of a previous procedure that justifies the use of a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. justifying a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.

Name: Direct Award Justification Text
Description: The justification for using a procedure which allows directly awarding contracts, i.e. a procedure that does not require publishing a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union.
Element: Please explain in a clear and comprehensive manner why the award of the contract without prior publication in the Official Journal of the European Union is lawful, by stating the relevant facts and, as appropriate, the conclusions of law in accordance with the directive:  (500 words maximum)

Name: Award Criteria Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots or one or more groups of lots. The information in the award criteria section refers to this lot, these lots, this group, or these groups.

Name: Award Criterion Type
Description: Whether the criterion concerns the price, the cost, or a non-price non-cost attribute of the tender. (Price is the acquisition price; cost is any other non-price monetary criterion.)

Name: Award Criterion Name
Description: The name of the award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Description
Description: The description of the award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Number
Description: A number linked to an award criterion.

Name: Award Criterion Number Weight
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of weight (e.g. a percentage).

Name: Award Criterion Number Fixed
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a fixed value (e.g. a fixed price, a fixed cost).

Name: Award Criterion Number Threshold
Description: Whether the number linked to an award criterion is a type of threshold (e.g. a minimum score, a maximum number of tenders with the highest score passing).

Name: Award Criteria Complicated
Description: The mathematical equation or any other description used for complicated weighing of criteria (e.g. non-linear weighing, the analytic hierarchy process) when a weighing cannot be expressed per criterion.

Name: Award Criteria Order Justification
Description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighing.

Name: Techniques Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the techniques section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Electronic Auction
Description: An electronic auction is used.

Name: Communication Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the communication section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Review Deadline Description
Description: The description of the time limits for review procedures.

Name: Notice Value
Description: The value of all contracts awarded in this notice, including options and renewals.

Name: Result Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of a lot. The information in the procedure lot result section refers to this lot.

Name: Winner Chosen
Description: Whether a winner was chosen.

Name: Not Awarded Reason
Description: The reason for not choosing a winner.
Element: No tenders or requests to participate were received or all were rejected

Name: Not Awarded Reason
Description: The reason for not choosing a winner.

Name: Received Submissions Count
Description: Number of tenders or requests to participate received. Tenders including variants or multiple tenders submitted (for one lot) by the same tenderer should be counted as one tender.

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from SMEs

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from tenderers from other EU Member States

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received from tenderers from non-EU Member States

Name: Received Submissions Type
Description: The type of tenders or requests to participate received. The total number of tenders received must be given. When a notice does not fall under Directive 2009/81/EC and is not about social or other specific services, the number of tenders received from micro, small and medium enterprises; the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in other European Economic Area countries and the number of tenders received from tenderers registered in countries outside of the European Economic Area must also be given. All tenders must be counted, regardless of whether they are admissible or inadmissible. For tenders submitted by a group of tenderers (e.g. a consortium), the tender must be counted in the relevant category (e.g. SME) if the majority of the work is expected to be done by tenderers which fall within this category (e.g. they are SMEs).
Element: Number of tenders received by electronic means

Name: Tender Identifier
Description: An identifier of a tender. The information in the tender section refers to this tender.

Name: Tender Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of a lot or a group of lots for which the tender was submitted. The information in the tender section refers to this lot.

Name: Tender Value
Description: The value of the tender or another result; including options and renewals. In case of the modification notice, the value of the modification.

Name: Concession Revenue User
Description: The estimated revenue coming from the users of the concession (e.g. fees and fines).
Element: Revenue from the payment of fees and fines by the users

Name: Concession Revenue Buyer
Description: The estimated revenue coming from the buyer who granted the concession (e.g. prizes and payments).
Element: Prizes, payments or other financial advantages provided by the contracting authority/entity

Name: Concession Value Description
Description: The description of the method used for calculating the estimated value of the concession and any other relevant information concerning the value of the concession.
Element: Any other details relevant to the value of the concession according to Art. 8(3) of the directive:

Name: Tender Variant
Description: The tender is a variant.

Name: Subcontracting
Description: Whether at least a part of the contract will be subcontracted.

Name: Subcontracting Value Known
Description: The buyer knows at least the estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.

Name: Subcontracting Value
Description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.

Name: Subcontracting Percentage Known
Description: The buyer knows at least the estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.

Name: Subcontracting Percentage
Description: The estimated percentage of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties compared to the whole contract.

Name: Subcontracting Description
Description: The description of the part of the contract that the contractor will subcontract to third parties.

Name: Contract Identifier
Description: An identifier of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision. The information in the contract section refers to this contract or decision.

Name: Contract Tender Identifier
Description: An identifier of the tender or another result that led to this contract.

Name: Contract Title
Description: The name of the contract or, in case of voluntary-ex ante transparency notices and design contest result notices, of the decision.

Name: Winner Decision Date
Description: The date of the official decision choosing the winning tender.

Name: Contract Conclusion Date
Description: The date when the contract was concluded. Typically, this is the date when the last contractual party signed the contract. However, if no contract is signed, then the date of contract conclusion may correspond to other dates (e.g. the date when the buyer notified the winning tenderer). The date of contract conclusion is always later than the end of the standstill period and only once any evidence submitted by the winner has been verified.

Name: Contract Framework Agreement
Description: The contract is awarded within a framework agreement.

Name: Contract URL
Description: The uniform resource locator (e.g. the web address) of the contract.

Name: Contract EU Funds Name
Description: The name of the European Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. about concrete projects, not just operational programs.)

Name: Contract EU Funds Identifier
Description: An identifier of the European Union funds used to at least partially finance the contract. The most concrete information must be given (e.g. about concrete projects, not just operational programs.)

Name: Strategic Procurement Notice Section Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the strategic procurement section refers to this section or these sections.

Name: Strategic Procurement
Description: Use of a technical specification, selection criterion, award criterion, or contract performance condition aims to reduce the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfil social objectives and/or buy an innovative work, supply or service.

Name: Strategic Procurement Description
Description: Description of the use of a technical specification, selection criterion, award criterion, or contract performance condition aims to reduce the environmental impacts of the procurement, fulfil social objectives and/or buy an innovative work, supply or service.

Name: Green Procurement
Description: An approach to reducing the environmental impacts of the work, supply or service (e.g. requesting compliance with an environmental label).

Name: Social Procurement
Description: A social objective promoted by the works, supplies or services (e.g. fair working conditions).

Name: Innovative Procurement
Description: An indication that innovative works, supplies or services are being bought (e.g. the procured works, supplies or services being novel for the whole market).

Name: Accessibility
Description: The use of accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities in the technical specifications.

Name: Accessibility Justification
Description: The justification for not including accessibility criteria even though the procurement is intended for use by natural persons.

Name: Buyer Review Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the additional information section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Buyer Review Complainants
Description: The number of organisations that requested the buyer to review any of its decisions (e.g. the technical specifications, award decision).

Name: Buyer Review Requests Count
Description: The number of requests the buyer received to review any of its decisions.

Name: Buyer Review Requests Irregularity Type
Description: The type of irregularity alleged in the review requests.

Name: Additional Information Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the additional information section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Procurement Relaunch
Description: This cancelled or unsuccessful procedure or lot will be relaunched.

Name: Additional Information
Description: Any information not mentioned elsewhere.

Name: Unpublished Identifier
Description: Identifier of the field that shall not be immediately published. Only fields concerning the Result value and groups of fields concerning the Tender and Procedure Lot Result can be unpublished. In the case of the sectoral Directive, the award criteria, the procurement procedure, certain dates and in certain cases information about the nature and quantity of a service can be unpublished as well.

Name: Unpublished Justification Code
Description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field.

Name: Unpublished Justification Description
Description: The justification for not immediately publishing a field and for the choice of a later date at which it can be published.

Name: Unpublished Accessibility Date
Description: The later date at which the originally unpublished field shall be published.

Name: Procedure Identifier
Description: The European Public Procurement Procedure Identifier, a unique identifier of a procurement procedure. Including this identifier in all published versions of this notice (e.g. published on TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement procedures around the EU.

Name: Notice Identifier
Description: The European Public Procurement Notice Identifier of this notice. Including this identifier in all published version of this notice (e.g. TED, national publication portals, regional publication portals) allows unique identification of procurement notices around the EU.

Name: Notice Version
Description: The version of the notice. This helps, for example, to avoid errors caused by multiple change notices sent at a similar time.

Name: Procedure Legal Basis
Description: The legal basis (e.g. a European Directive or Regulation, national law) under which the procurement procedure takes place.

Name: Form Type
Description: The type of form according to procurement legislation.

Name: Notice Type
Description: The type of notice according to procurement legislation.

Name: Notice Dispatch Date
Description: The date and time when the notice has been sent to TED.
Element: Date of dispatch of this notice: (dd/mm/yyyy)

Name: Notice Publication Date Preferred
Description: The preferred date of publication of the notice on TED (e.g. to avoid publication during a national holiday).

Name: Notice Official Language
Description: The language(s) in which this notice is officially available. These linguistic versions are equally legally valid.

Name: Previous Planning Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of a prior information notice used only for information, the identifier of a part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure. The information in the previous planning section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Previous Planning Identifier
Description: The identifier of a prior information notice or another similar notice related to this notice.

Name: Previous Planning Part Identifier
Description: The identifier of a part of a prior information notice or another similar notice related to this notice.

Name: Organisation Notice Section Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more sections within this notice. The information in the organisation section refers to this section or these sections.

Name: Organisation Name
Description: The official name of the organisation.

Name: Organisation Identifier
Description: An identifier of the organisation. All of the organisation's identifiers shall be given.

Name: Organisation Part Name
Description: The name of a part of an organisation (e.g. the relevant department of a large buyer).

Name: Organisation Street
Description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the organisation's physical address and further identification (e.g. building number).

Name: Organisation City
Description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Post Code
Description: The post code of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Country Subdivision
Description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) of the organisation's physical address. The NUTS3 classification code must be used.

Name: Organisation Country Code
Description: The country of the organisation's physical address.

Name: Organisation Contact Point
Description: The name of the department or other contact point for communicating with the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the contact point may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Regulation (EU) 2018/1725).

Name: Organisation Contact Email Address
Description: The email for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the email may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Contact Telephone Number
Description: The telephone for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the telephone may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Contact Fax
Description: The fax for contacting the organisation. To avoid unnecessary processing of personal data, the fax may allow the identification of a physical person only when necessary (in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation).

Name: Organisation Internet Address
Description: The website of the organisation.

Name: Organisation eDelivery Gateway
Description: The organisation's uniform resource locator for exchange of data and documents.

Name: Organisation Natural Person
Description: The organisation is a natural person.

Name: Organisation Role
Description: The role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. buyer, winner). A notice must contain all organisations in the procedure that have the role of a buyer; a winner; a review body; a buyer acquiring supplies and/or services intended for other buyers; a buyer awarding public contracts or concluding framework agreements for works, supplies or services intended for other buyers.

Name: Organisation Subrole
Description: The sub-role of the organisation in the procurement procedure (e.g. group leader, organisation providing additional information about the procurement procedure).

Name: Buyer Profile URL
Description: The website where the buyer publishes information regarding procurement procedures (e.g. notices, procurement documents).

Name: Buyer Legal Type
Description: The type of buyer according to procurement legislation (e.g. central government authority, body governed by public law, public undertaking).

Name: Buyer Contracting Entity
Description: The buyer is a contracting entity.

Name: Activity Authority
Description: The main activity of the contracting authority.

Name: Activity Entity
Description: The main activity of the contracting entity.

Name: Purpose Lot Identifier
Description: The identifier of a lot. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of a part of the notice that may later become a lot or a self-standing procedure. The information in the purpose section refers to this lot or part.

Name: Internal Identifier
Description: The internal identifier used for files regarding the procurement procedure or lot before a procedure identifier is given (e.g. coming from the buyer's document management system or procurement planning system).

Name: Main Nature
Description: The main nature (e.g. works) of what is being bought. In case of mixed procurement (e.g. a procedure for both works and services), the main nature may be, for example, the one with the highest estimated value. This information must be given for the whole procedure.

Name: Additional Nature
Description: The nature (e.g. services) of what is being bought, additional to Main Nature.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Title
Description: The name of the procurement procedure or lot.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Description
Description: The description of the nature and quantity of what is being bought or of the needs and requirements that should be met in this procedure or lot. In case of a modification notice, the description of the procurement before and after the modification.

Name: Estimated Value
Description: The estimated maximum value of the procurement procedure or lot. Estimated refers to estimation at the time of launching the call for competition. Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system, over their whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Estimated Value
Description: The estimated maximum value of the procurement procedure or lot. Estimated refers to estimation at the time of launching the call for competition. Maximum value means a value covering all contracts to be awarded within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system, over their whole duration, including options and renewals.

Name: Classification Type
Description: The type of classification describing the purchase (e.g. the common procurement vocabulary).

Name: Main Classification Code
Description: The code from the classification that best characterizes the purchase.

Name: Additional Classification Codes
Description: An additional code from the classification that also characterize the purchase.

Name: Quantity
Description: The number of units required.

Name: Unit
Description: The unit which the good, service, or work comes in, for example hours or kilograms. Where CPV code is a supply which does not need a further unit (e.g. cars), then no unit needs to be given and quantity is taken to be a count, e.g. the "number of cars".

Name: Options
Description: The buyer reserves the right (not an obligation) for additional purchases from the contractor (while the contract is valid).

Name: Options Description
Description: The description of the options.

Name: Recurrence
Description: Procurement whose purpose is likely to also be included in another procedure in the foreseeable future. (For example, a regularly re-tendered municipal service. This does not include awarding multiple contracts within a single qualification system, framework agreement, or a dynamic purchasing system.)

Name: Recurrence Description
Description: Any additional information about recurrence (e.g. estimated timing).
Element: Estimated timing for further notices to be published

Name: Place Performance Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the place of performance section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Place Performance Street
Description: The name of the street, road, avenue, etc., of the place of performance and further identification (e.g. building number).
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance City
Description: The name of the locality (city, town or village) of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Post Code
Description: The postcode of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Country Subdivision
Description: The location according to the common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS). The NUTS3 classification code must be used.

Name: Place Performance Country Code
Description: The country of the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Place Performance Services Other
Description: There are other restrictions on the place of performance (e.g. "anywhere in the European Economic Area", "anywhere in the given country").

Name: Place Performance Additional Information
Description: Additional information about the place of performance.
Element: Main site or place of performance

Name: Duration Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures.  The information in the duration section refers to this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts)

Name: Duration Start Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will start.

Name: Duration Period
Description: The (estimated) period from the start to the end of the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system. This must include any options and renewals.

Name: Duration End Date
Description: The (estimated) date when the contract, framework agreement, dynamic purchasing system or qualification system will finish.

Name: Duration Other
Description: The duration is unknown, unlimited, etc.

Name: Renewal Maximum
Description: The maximum number of times the contract can be renewed. By renewing, the buyer reserves the right (i.e. not an obligation) to renew the contract (i.e. extend its duration) without a new procurement procedure. For example, a contract may be valid for one year and the buyer may keep a possibility to renew it (e.g. once, twice) for another three months, if he is content with the services he received.

Name: Renewal Description
Description: Any other information about the renewal(s).

Name: Funds Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. The information in the EU funds section refers to this lot or these lots.

Name: EU Funds
Description: The procurement is at least partially financed by European Union funds such as the European Structural and Investment Funds or grants awarded by the European Union.
Element: The procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds

Name: Cross Border Law
Description: The applicable law when buyers from different countries procure together within one procurement procedure.
Element: In the case of joint procurement involving different countries, state applicable national procurement law:

Name: Procedure Features
Description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stage(s)) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found. This information must be given when the procedure is not one of those mentioned in the procurement Directives. This can be the case for example for concessions, for social and other specific services, and in case of voluntary publication of procurement procedures below the EU procurement thresholds.

Name: Lots Max Allowed
Description: The maximum number of lots for which one tenderer can submit tenders.

Name: Lots Max Allowed
Description: The maximum number of lots for which one tenderer can submit tenders.

Name: Lots All Required
Description: The tenderer must submit tenders for all lots.

Name: Lots Max Awarded
Description: The maximum number of lots for which contract(s) can be awarded to one tenderer.
Element: Maximum number of lots that may be awarded to one tenderer

Name: Group Identifier
Description: The identifier of a group of lots in the procedure.

Name: Group Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of several lots within this procedure. These lots form a group of lots for which one tender can be submitted and evaluated.

Name: Exclusion Grounds
Description: The brief description of criteria regarding the personal situation of tenderers that may lead to their exclusion. This must include a list of all such criteria and indicate required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation). This can also include specific national exclusion grounds.

Name: Selection Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. The information in the selection criteria section refers to this lot or these lots.

Name: Selection Criteria Type
Description: The criteria (or criterion) concern(s), for example, economic and financial standing or technical and professional ability.
Element: Execution of the service is reserved to a particular profession

Name: Selection Criteria Used
Description: The criteria (or criterion) of the given type are (is) used, unused, or (in case of prior information notice used as a call for competition or to reduce time limits) the use is not yet known.

Name: Selection Criteria Name
Description: The name of the selection criteria (or criterion).
Element: List and brief description of selection criteria

Name: Selection Criteria Name
Description: The name of the selection criteria (or criterion).
Element: List and brief description of selection criteria

Name: Selection Criteria Description
Description: The brief description of the selection criteria (or criterion), including minimum requirements, required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation) and how the criteria or criterion will be used to select candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
Element: Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required

Name: Selection Criteria Description
Description: The brief description of the selection criteria (or criterion), including minimum requirements, required information (e.g. self-declaration, documentation) and how the criteria or criterion will be used to select candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure (if a maximum number of candidates was set).
Element: Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required

Name: Requirements Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the other requirements section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Reserved Participation
Description: Whether participation is reserved for specific organisations (e.g. sheltered workshops, organisations pursuing a public service mission).
Element: The contract is reserved to sheltered workshops and economic operators aiming at the social and professional integration of disabled or disadvantaged persons;

Name: Performing Staff Qualification
Description: Whether the names and professional qualifications of the staff assigned to perform the contract must be given.
Element: Information about staff responsible for the performance of the concession

Name: Security Clearance
Description: A security clearance is required.

Name: Security Clearance Deadline
Description: The time limit by which tenderers who do not hold a security clearance may obtain it.

Name: Security Clearance Description
Description: Additional information about the security clearance (e.g. which level of security clearance is required, which team members must have it, whether it is necessary already for accessing the procurement documents or only for contract execution).

Name: Terms Lot Identifier
Description: An identifier of one or more lots. In case of PINs used only for information, the identifier of one or more parts of the notice that may later become lots or a self-standing procedures. The information in the contract terms section refer this lot (or part) or these lots (or parts).

Name: Reserved Execution
Description: Whether the execution of the contract must be performed in the framework of sheltered employment programmes.
Element: The execution of the concession is restricted to the framework of sheltered employment programmes

Name: Tenderer Legal Form
